name: JarInputStream
comment: The JarInputStream class is used to read the contents of a JAR file from any input stream. It extends the class java.util.zip.ZipInputStream with support for reading an optional Manifest entry. The Manifest can be used to store meta-information about the JAR file and its entries.

constructors.name: JarInputStream
constructors.comment: Creates a new JarInputStream and reads the optional manifest. If a manifest is present, also attempts to verify the signatures if the JarInputStream is signed.

constructors.name: JarInputStream
constructors.comment: Creates a new JarInputStream and reads the optional manifest. If a manifest is present and verify is true, also attempts to verify the signatures if the JarInputStream is signed.

methods.name: getManifest
methods.comment: Returns the Manifest for this JAR file, or null if none.

methods.name: getNextEntry
methods.comment:
Reads the next ZIP file entry and positions the stream at the
 beginning of the entry data. If verification has been enabled,
 any invalid signature detected while positioning the stream for
 the next entry will result in an exception.

methods.name: getNextJarEntry
methods.comment:
Reads the next JAR file entry and positions the stream at the
 beginning of the entry data. If verification has been enabled,
 any invalid signature detected while positioning the stream for
 the next entry will result in an exception.

methods.name: read
methods.comment: Reads from the current JAR file entry into an array of bytes. If len is not zero, the method blocks until some input is available; otherwise, no bytes are read and 0 is returned. If verification has been enabled, any invalid signature on the current entry will be reported at some point before the end of the entry is reached.
